Following the link below, I read a recent note that was kinda interesting.
Appearently, IE6 (SP1) has added the ability to dump the cache.  Here is a
bit of javascript I wrote to do it:

<a href="javascript:void
document.execCommand('ClearAuthenticationCache',false, null)">Clear
Authentication</a>

Even more interesting is that I added this link to my Favorites/Links (which
I show as a toolbar) and now have a way to clear my authentication cache any
time I want to.  It would be nice for MS to have made this available in
general, but it's neat to have found it anyway.

For those of you who want a logout (at least when IE6 SP1 is used), you
could extend this to clear the cache, then GET a "thanks for using us" page,
or whatever...

---
Seairth Jacobs
seairth@...
